discourse_list.title: [CLOSED] Opcode to transfer ethers into block reward

content.content: Abstract Some contracts uses fees as a spam protection. This money mostly are using as a reward to contract owners, but for simple contracts like registries the fee size could be illogically big as a reward for zero activity from the contract owners. It’s especially relevant when we talk about socially meaningful contracts. And it seems fair enough to transfer this fee into a block reward. Seems like it requires a new opcode for this.   I feel like I saw this idea before, but I couldn’t find the EIP for it. If it’s so provide a link please.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is explaining a proposal to transfer fees into a block reward for socially meaningful contracts. They are also asking if there is an existing EIP for this idea and requesting a link if there is one.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: There is the COINBASE opcode and so you can CALL with COINBASE as the recipient arg. We don’t need a special opcode therefore.
